verses.original: He made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of sea cow hides above.
verses.korean: 장막 덮개를 붉게 물들인 숫양 가죽으로 만들고, 그 위에 해달 가죽 덮개를 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing up.
verses.korean: 아카시아 나무로 성막 널판을 만들어 세웠어요.

verses.original: Ten cubits was the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the width of each board.
verses.korean: 각 널판의 길이는 열 규빗, 너비는 한 규빗 반이에요.

verses.original: Each board had two tenons, joined to one another. He made all the boards of the tabernacle this way.
verses.korean: 각 널판에 촉 두 개가 있어 서로 연결되었어요. 성막의 모든 널판을 이렇게 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side southward.
verses.korean: 성막을 위해 널판을 만들었어요. 남쪽에 스무 개의 널판을 세웠어요.

verses.original: He made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards: two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
verses.korean: 스무 개의 널판 아래에 은 받침 마흔 개를 만들었어요. 한 널판 아래에 두 촉을 위한 받침 두 개, 다른 널판 아래에도 두 촉을 위한 받침 두 개씩이에요.

verses.original: For the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty boards
verses.korean: 성막 둘째 면, 북쪽에도 널판 스무 개를 만들었어요.

verses.original: and their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
verses.korean: 은 받침 마흔 개도 만들었어요. 한 널판 아래에 받침 두 개, 다른 널판 아래에도 받침 두 개씩이에요.

verses.original: For the far part of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
verses.korean: 성막 뒤쪽 서편에는 널판 여섯 개를 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made two boards for the corners of the tabernacle in the far part.
verses.korean: 성막 뒤쪽 모퉁이를 위해 널판 두 개를 만들었어요.

verses.original: They were double beneath, and in the same way they were all the way to its top to one ring. He did this to both of them in the two corners.
verses.korean: 아래는 두 겹이고 위까지 한 고리로 연결되었어요. 두 모퉁이의 두 널판을 다 이렇게 만들었어요.

verses.original: There were eight boards and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets—under every board two sockets.
verses.korean: 널판 여덟 개와 은 받침 열여섯 개가 있었어요. 각 널판 아래에 받침 두 개씩이에요.

verses.original: He made bars of acacia wood: five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
verses.korean: 아카시아 나무로 띠를 만들었어요. 성막 한쪽 널판을 위해 다섯 개,

verses.original: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the hinder part westward.
verses.korean: 성막 다른 쪽 널판을 위해 다섯 개, 성막 뒤쪽 서편 널판을 위해 다섯 개를 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made the middle bar to pass through in the middle of the boards from the one end to the other.
verses.korean: 가운데 띠는 널판 중간으로 한쪽 끝에서 다른 쪽 끝까지 지나가게 만들었어요.

verses.original: He overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold as places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
verses.korean: 널판을 금으로 덮고, 띠를 꿸 금 고리를 만들고, 띠도 금으로 덮었어요.

verses.original: He made the veil of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, with cherubim. He made it the work of a skillful workman.
verses.korean: 청색, 자주색, 진홍색 실과 고운 모시실로 휘장을 만들었어요. 그 위에 그룹을 정교하게 수놓았어요.

verses.original: He made four pillars of acacia for it, and overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were of gold. He cast four sockets of silver for them.
verses.korean: 휘장을 위해 아카시아 나무로 기둥 네 개를 만들고 금으로 덮었어요. 갈고리는 금이고, 은 받침 네 개를 부어 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made a screen for the door of the tent, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer;
verses.korean: 장막 문의 덮개를 청색, 자주색, 진홍색 실과 고운 모시실로 만들었어요. 수놓은 것이에요.

verses.original: and the five pillars of it with their hooks. He overlaid their capitals and their fillets with gold, and their five sockets were of bronze.
verses.korean: 덮개의 기둥 다섯 개와 갈고리를 만들었어요. 기둥 머리와 가로대를 금으로 덮고, 받침 다섯 개는 청동으로 만들었어요.

verses.original: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood. Its length was two and a half cubits, and its width a cubit and a half, and a cubit and a half its height.
verses.korean: 브살렐이 아카시아 나무로 궤를 만들었어요. 길이가 두 규빗 반, 너비가 한 규빗 반, 높이가 한 규빗 반이에요.

verses.original: He overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside, and made a molding of gold for it around it.
verses.korean: 안팎을 순금으로 덮고, 주위에 금 테두리를 만들었어요.

verses.original: He cast four rings of gold for it, in its four feet—two rings on its one side, and two rings on its other side.
verses.korean: 금 고리 네 개를 부어 만들어서 네 발에 달았어요. 한쪽에 두 개, 다른 쪽에 두 개씩이에요.

verses.original: He made poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.
verses.korean: 아카시아 나무로 채를 만들고 금으로 덮었어요.

verses.original: He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
verses.korean: 궤 양쪽의 고리에 채를 꿰어서 궤를 옮길 수 있게 했어요.

verses.original: He made a mercy seat of pure gold. Its length was two and a half cubits, and a cubit and a half its width.
verses.korean: 순금으로 속죄소를 만들었어요. 길이가 두 규빗 반, 너비가 한 규빗 반이에요.

verses.original: He made two cherubim of gold. He made them of beaten work, at the two ends of the mercy seat:
verses.korean: 금으로 그룹 둘을 만들었어요. 두들겨서 속죄소 양쪽 끝에 만들었어요.

verses.original: one cherub at the one end, and one cherub at the other end. He made the cherubim of one piece with the mercy seat at its two ends.
verses.korean: 한쪽 끝에 그룹 하나, 다른 쪽 끝에 그룹 하나를 속죄소 양쪽 끝과 한 덩어리로 만들었어요.

verses.original: The cherubim spread out their wings above, covering the mercy seat with their wings, with their faces toward one another. The faces of the cherubim were toward the mercy seat.
verses.korean: 그룹들이 날개를 위로 펴서 속죄소를 덮었어요. 서로 얼굴을 마주하고 있고, 그룹들의 얼굴이 속죄소를 향했어요.

verses.original: He made the table of acacia wood. Its length was two cubits, and its width was a cubit, and its height was a cubit and a half.
verses.korean: 아카시아 나무로 상을 만들었어요. 길이가 두 규빗, 너비가 한 규빗, 높이가 한 규빗 반이에요.

verses.original: He overlaid it with pure gold, and made a gold molding around it.
verses.korean: 순금으로 덮고 주위에 금 테두리를 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made a border of a hand's width around it, and made a golden molding on its border around it.
verses.korean: 주위에 손바닥 너비의 턱을 만들고, 그 턱 주위에 금 테두리를 만들었어요.

verses.original: He cast four rings of gold for it, and put the rings in the four corners that were on its four feet.
verses.korean: 금 고리 네 개를 부어 만들어서 네 발 위 네 모퉁이에 달았어요.

verses.original: The rings were close by the border, the places for the poles to carry the table.
verses.korean: 고리들이 턱 가까이에 있어서 상을 옮기는 채를 꿸 수 있게 했어요.

verses.original: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold, to carry the table.
verses.korean: 아카시아 나무로 채를 만들고 금으로 덮어서 상을 옮기게 했어요.

verses.original: He made the vessels which were on the table, its dishes, its spoons, its bowls, and its pitchers with which to pour out, of pure gold.
verses.korean: 상 위에 놓을 기구들을 순금으로 만들었어요. 접시, 숟가락, 대접, 부을 때 쓰는 병들이에요.

verses.original: He made the lamp stand of pure gold. He made the lamp stand of beaten work. Its base, its shaft, its cups, its buds, and its flowers were of one piece with it.
verses.korean: 순금으로 등잔대를 만들었어요. 두들겨서 만들었어요. 받침대, 줄기, 잔, 꽃봉오리, 꽃이 한 덩어리였어요.

verses.original: There were six branches going out of its sides: three branches of the lamp stand out of its one side, and three branches of the lamp stand out of its other side:
verses.korean: 양옆에서 가지 여섯 개가 나왔어요. 한쪽에서 세 가지, 다른 쪽에서 세 가지가 나왔어요.

verses.original: three cups made like almond blossoms in one branch, a bud and a flower, and three cups made like almond blossoms in the other branch, a bud and a flower; so for the six branches going out of the lamp stand.
verses.korean: 한 가지에 살구꽃 모양의 잔 세 개와 꽃봉오리와 꽃이 있고, 다른 가지에도 살구꽃 모양의 잔 세 개와 꽃봉오리와 꽃이 있어요. 등잔대에서 나온 여섯 가지 모두 그래요.

verses.original: In the lamp stand were four cups made like almond blossoms, its buds and its flowers;
verses.korean: 등잔대 자체에는 살구꽃 모양의 잔 네 개와 꽃봉오리와 꽃이 있어요.

verses.original: and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of it.
verses.korean: 두 가지 아래에 꽃봉오리 하나, 또 두 가지 아래에 꽃봉오리 하나, 또 두 가지 아래에 꽃봉오리 하나가 한 덩어리로 있어요. 나온 여섯 가지 모두 그래요.

verses.original: Their buds and their branches were of one piece with it. The whole thing was one beaten work of pure gold.
verses.korean: 꽃봉오리와 가지들이 한 덩어리였어요. 전체가 순금을 두들겨 만든 하나의 작품이에요.

verses.original: He made its seven lamps, and its snuffers, and its snuff dishes, of pure gold.
verses.korean: 등잔 일곱 개와 심지 집게와 불똥 그릇을 순금으로 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made it of a talent of pure gold, with all its vessels.
verses.korean: 순금 한 달란트로 등잔대와 그 모든 기구를 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made the altar of incense of acacia wood. It was square: its length was a cubit, and its width a cubit. Its height was two cubits. Its horns were of one piece with it.
verses.korean: 아카시아 나무로 향단을 만들었어요. 네모나고 길이가 한 규빗, 너비가 한 규빗, 높이가 두 규빗이에요. 뿔은 향단과 한 덩어리였어요.

verses.original: He overlaid it with pure gold: its top, its sides around it, and its horns. He made a gold molding around it.
verses.korean: 윗면과 옆면과 뿔을 순금으로 덮었어요. 주위에 금 테두리를 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made two golden rings for it under its molding crown, on its two ribs, on its two sides, for places for poles with which to carry it.
verses.korean: 테두리 아래 양쪽에 금 고리 두 개를 만들었어요. 채를 꿰어 옮길 수 있게 했어요.

verses.original: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.
verses.korean: 아카시아 나무로 채를 만들고 금으로 덮었어요.

verses.original: He made the holy anointing oil and the pure incense of sweet spices, after the art of the perfumer.
verses.korean: 거룩한 기름 부음의 기름과 향기로운 향품으로 순수한 향을 만들었어요. 향 만드는 기술로 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood. It was square. Its length was five cubits, its width was five cubits, and its height was three cubits.
verses.korean: 아카시아 나무로 번제단을 만들었어요. 네모나고 길이가 다섯 규빗, 너비가 다섯 규빗, 높이가 세 규빗이에요.

verses.original: He made its horns on its four corners. Its horns were of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with bronze.
verses.korean: 네 모퉁이에 뿔을 만들었어요. 뿔은 제단과 한 덩어리였고, 청동으로 덮었어요.

verses.original: He made all the vessels of the altar: the pots, the shovels, the basins, the forks, and the fire pans. He made all its vessels of bronze.
verses.korean: 제단의 모든 기구를 만들었어요: 통, 부삽, 대야, 고기 갈고리, 불 옮기는 그릇이에요. 모든 기구를 청동으로 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made for the altar a grating of a network of bronze, under the ledge around it beneath, reaching halfway up.
verses.korean: 제단을 위해 청동 그물 모양의 격자를 만들어서 제단 아래 턱 밑에 두어 제단 중간까지 오게 했어요.

verses.original: He cast four rings for the four corners of bronze grating, to be places for the poles.
verses.korean: 청동 격자의 네 모퉁이에 고리 네 개를 부어 만들어서 채를 꿸 수 있게 했어요.

verses.original: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with bronze.
verses.korean: 아카시아 나무로 채를 만들고 청동으로 덮었어요.

verses.original: He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, with which to carry it. He made it hollow with planks.
verses.korean: 제단 양쪽의 고리에 채를 꿰어서 옮길 수 있게 했어요. 널판으로 속이 빈 상자처럼 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made the basin of bronze, and its base of bronze, out of the mirrors of the ministering women who ministered at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.korean: 청동으로 물두멍과 받침을 만들었어요. 회막 문에서 섬기는 여자들의 거울로 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made the court: for the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, one hundred cubits;
verses.korean: 뜰을 만들었어요. 남쪽에는 고운 모시실로 만든 휘장이 백 규빗이에요.

verses.original: their pillars were twenty, and their sockets twenty, of bronze; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
verses.korean: 기둥이 스무 개, 청동 받침이 스무 개예요. 기둥의 갈고리와 가로대는 은이에요.

verses.original: For the north side one hundred cubits, their pillars twenty, and their sockets twenty, of bronze; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.
verses.korean: 북쪽에도 백 규빗이에요. 기둥 스무 개, 청동 받침 스무 개예요. 기둥의 갈고리와 가로대는 은이에요.

verses.original: For the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.
verses.korean: 서쪽에는 오십 규빗의 휘장이에요. 기둥 열 개, 받침 열 개예요. 기둥의 갈고리와 가로대는 은이에요.

verses.original: For the east side eastward fifty cubits,
verses.korean: 동쪽에도 오십 규빗이에요.

verses.original: the hangings for the one side were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three;
verses.korean: 문 한쪽의 휘장이 열다섯 규빗이에요. 기둥 세 개, 받침 세 개예요.

verses.original: and so for the other side: on this hand and that hand by the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
verses.korean: 문 다른 쪽도 마찬가지예요. 뜰 문 양쪽에 열다섯 규빗의 휘장이 있어요. 기둥 세 개, 받침 세 개씩이에요.

verses.original: All the hangings around the court were of fine twined linen.
verses.korean: 뜰 주위의 모든 휘장은 고운 모시실로 만들었어요.

verses.original: The sockets for the pillars were of bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver. Their capitals were overlaid with silver. All the pillars of the court had silver bands.
verses.korean: 기둥 받침은 청동이에요. 기둥의 갈고리와 가로대는 은이에요. 기둥 머리는 은으로 덮었어요. 뜰의 모든 기둥에 은 가로대가 있어요.

verses.original: The screen for the gate of the court was the work of the embroiderer, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. Twenty cubits was the length, and the height along the width was five cubits, like the hangings of the court.
verses.korean: 뜰 문의 덮개는 청색, 자주색, 진홍색 실과 고운 모시실로 수놓아 만들었어요. 길이가 스무 규빗, 높이가 다섯 규빗으로 뜰의 휘장과 같아요.

verses.original: Their pillars were four, and their sockets four, of bronze; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals, and their fillets, of silver.
verses.korean: 기둥 네 개, 청동 받침 네 개예요. 갈고리는 은이고, 기둥 머리 덮개와 가로대도 은이에요.

verses.original: All the pins of the tabernacle, and around the court, were of bronze.
verses.korean: 성막의 모든 말뚝과 뜰 주위의 말뚝은 청동이에요.

verses.original: These are the amounts of materials used for the tabernacle, even the Tabernacle of the Testimony, as they were counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.korean: 이것은 성막, 곧 증거의 성막에 쓴 재료의 양이에요. 모세의 명령대로 레위 사람들을 위해 제사장 아론의 아들 이다말이 셌어요.

verses.original: Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.korean: 유다 지파 훌의 손자, 우리의 아들 브살렐이 여호와께서 모세에게 명령하신 모든 것을 만들었어요.

verses.original: With him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a skillful workman, and an embroiderer in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen.
verses.korean: 단 지파 아히사막의 아들 오홀리압이 그와 함께 했어요. 그는 새기는 자, 솜씨 좋은 장인, 청색과 자주색과 진홍색 실과 고운 모시로 수놓는 자였어요.

verses.original: All the gold that was used for the work in all the work of the sanctuary, even the gold of the offering, was twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.korean: 성소의 모든 일에 쓴 금, 곧 예물의 금은 성소 세겔로 스물아홉 달란트와 칠백삼십 세겔이에요.

verses.original: The silver of those who were counted of the congregation was one hundred talents and one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary:
verses.korean: 세어진 회중의 은은 성소 세겔로 백 달란트와 천칠백칠십오 세겔이에요.

verses.original: a beka a head, that is, half a shekel, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, for everyone who passed over to those who were counted, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty men.
verses.korean: 한 사람당 한 베가, 곧 성소 세겔로 반 세겔씩이에요. 스무 살 이상으로 세어진 모든 사람, 육십만 삼천오백오십 명에게서 받은 것이에요.

verses.original: The one hundred talents of silver were for casting the sockets of the sanctuary and the sockets of the veil: one hundred sockets for the one hundred talents, one talent per socket.
verses.korean: 은 백 달란트로 성소의 받침과 휘장의 받침을 부어 만들었어요. 백 받침에 백 달란트, 한 받침에 한 달란트예요.

verses.original: From the one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, overlaid their capitals, and made fillets for them.
verses.korean: 천칠백칠십오 세겔로 기둥의 갈고리를 만들고, 기둥 머리를 덮고, 가로대를 만들었어요.

verses.original: The bronze of the offering was seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels.
verses.korean: 예물의 청동은 칠십 달란트와 이천사백 세겔이에요.

verses.original: With this he made the sockets to the door of the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar, the bronze grating for it, all the vessels of the altar,
verses.korean: 이것으로 회막 문의 받침, 청동 제단, 청동 격자, 제단의 모든 기구를 만들었어요.

verses.original: the sockets around the court, the sockets of the gate of the court, all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins around the court.
verses.korean: 뜰 주위의 받침, 뜰 문의 받침, 성막의 모든 말뚝, 뜰 주위의 모든 말뚝도 만들었어요.

verses.original: Of the blue, purple, and scarlet, they made finely worked garments for ministering in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.korean: 파란색, 자주색, 빨간색 실로 거룩한 곳에서 일할 때 입는 아름다운 옷을 만들었어요. 여호와께서 모세에게 말씀하신 대로 아론을 위한 거룩한 옷도 만들었어요.

verses.original: He made the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.korean: 금실과 파란색, 자주색, 빨간색 실과 가늘게 꼰 베실로 에봇을 만들었어요.

verses.original: They beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in with the blue, the purple, the scarlet, and the fine linen, the work of the skillful workman.
verses.korean: 금을 얇은 판으로 두드려 펴서 실처럼 가늘게 잘랐어요. 그리고 파란색, 자주색, 빨간색 실과 베실에 솜씨 좋게 짜 넣었어요.

verses.original: They made shoulder straps for it, joined together. It was joined together at the two ends.
verses.korean: 에봇에 어깨끈을 만들어 양쪽 끝에 붙였어요.

verses.original: The skillfully woven band that was on it, with which to fasten it on, was of the same piece, like its work: of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.korean: 에봇을 묶는 띠도 에봇과 한 조각으로 금실과 파란색, 자주색, 빨간색 실과 가늘게 꼰 베실로 똑같이 만들었어요. 여호와께서 모세에게 말씀하신 대로였어요.

verses.original: They worked the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold, engraved with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the children of Israel.
verses.korean: 호마노 보석을 금 테두리에 박아 넣고, 이스라엘 자손들의 이름을 도장처럼 새겼어요.

verses.original: He put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.korean: 이 보석들을 에봇 어깨끈에 붙여서 이스라엘 자손을 기억하는 보석으로 삼았어요. 여호와께서 모세에게 말씀하신 대로였어요.

verses.original: He made the breastplate, the work of a skillful workman, like the work of the ephod: of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.korean: 에봇과 같은 방법으로 흉패를 솜씨 좋게 만들었어요. 금실과 파란색, 자주색, 빨간색 실과 가늘게 꼰 베실로 만들었어요.

verses.original: It was square. They made the breastplate double. Its length was a span, and its width a span, being double.
verses.korean: 흉패는 네모난 모양이었어요. 두 겹으로 접어서 길이와 너비가 각각 한 뼘이 되게 했어요.

verses.original: They set in it four rows of stones. A row of ruby, topaz, and beryl was the first row;
verses.korean: 거기에 보석을 네 줄로 박았어요. 첫째 줄에는 홍보석, 황옥, 녹주옥을 박았어요.

verses.original: and the second row, a turquoise, a sapphire, and an emerald;
verses.korean: 둘째 줄에는 석류석, 남보석, 금강석을 박았어요.

verses.original: and the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.korean: 셋째 줄에는 호박, 백마노, 자수정을 박았어요.

verses.original: and the fourth row, a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper. They were enclosed in gold settings.
verses.korean: 넷째 줄에는 녹보석, 호마노, 벽옥을 박았어요. 모든 보석은 금 테두리에 박았어요.

verses.original: The stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names; like the engravings of a signet, everyone according to his name, for the twelve tribes.
verses.korean: 보석은 이스라엘 자손의 이름을 따라 열두 개였어요. 이스라엘 열두 지파의 이름을 하나씩 도장처럼 새겼어요.

verses.original: They made on the breastplate chains like cords, of braided work of pure gold.
verses.korean: 흉패에 순금으로 꼰 줄처럼 생긴 사슬을 만들었어요.

verses.original: They made two settings of gold, and two gold rings, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
verses.korean: 금 테두리 두 개와 금 고리 두 개를 만들어서 흉패 양쪽 위 끝에 달았어요.

verses.original: They put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.
verses.korean: 금 꼰 사슬 두 개를 흉패 끝의 두 고리에 끼웠어요.

verses.original: The other two ends of the two braided chains they put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, in its front.
verses.korean: 꼰 사슬의 다른 두 끝은 금 테두리에 끼워서 에봇 어깨끈 앞쪽에 달았어요.

verses.original: They made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on its edge, which was toward the side of the ephod inward.
verses.korean: 금 고리 두 개를 만들어 흉패 아래 양쪽 끝에 달았어요. 에봇 안쪽에 닿는 가장자리에 달았어요.

verses.original: They made two more rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulder straps of the ephod underneath, in its front, close by its coupling, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.korean: 금 고리 두 개를 더 만들어 에봇 어깨끈 아래쪽 앞면에 달았어요. 에봇 띠 위쪽, 이음새 가까이에 달았어요.

verses.original: They bound the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not come loose from the ephod, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.korean: 흉패의 고리와 에봇의 고리를 파란 끈으로 묶었어요. 그래서 흉패가 에봇 띠 위에 있고 에봇에서 떨어지지 않게 했어요. 여호와께서 모세에게 말씀하신 대로였어요.

verses.original: He made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.
verses.korean: 에봇 아래 입는 겉옷을 온통 파란색 베로 짜서 만들었어요.

verses.original: The opening of the robe in the middle of it was like the opening of a coat of mail, with a binding around its opening, that it should not be torn.
verses.korean: 겉옷 가운데에 머리를 넣는 구멍이 있었어요. 갑옷 구멍처럼 만들고 가장자리를 튼튼하게 해서 찢어지지 않게 했어요.

verses.original: They made on the skirts of the robe pomegranates of blue, purple, scarlet, and twined linen.
verses.korean: 겉옷 아래 가장자리에 파란색, 자주색, 빨간색 실과 꼰 베실로 석류 모양을 만들어 달았어요.

verses.original: They made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates around the skirts of the robe, between the pomegranates;
verses.korean: 순금으로 방울을 만들어서 겉옷 아래 가장자리 석류 사이사이에 달았어요.

verses.original: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, around the skirts of the robe, to minister in, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.korean: 방울 하나, 석류 하나, 방울 하나, 석류 하나 이렇게 번갈아 겉옷 아래 가장자리에 달았어요. 여호와께서 모세에게 말씀하신 대로 섬길 때 입는 옷이었어요.

verses.original: They made the tunics of fine linen of woven work for Aaron and for his sons,
verses.korean: 아론과 그의 아들들을 위해 가는 베로 속옷을 짜서 만들었어요.

verses.original: the turban of fine linen, the linen headbands of fine linen, the linen trousers of fine twined linen,
verses.korean: 가는 베로 관과 머리띠를 만들고, 가늘게 꼰 베실로 베 바지도 만들었어요.

verses.original: the sash of fine twined linen, blue, purple, and scarlet, the work of the embroiderer, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.korean: 가늘게 꼰 베실과 파란색, 자주색, 빨간색 실로 수놓아 띠를 만들었어요. 여호와께서 모세에게 말씀하신 대로였어요.

verses.original: They made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote on it an inscription, like the engravings of a signet: "HOLY TO YAHWEH".
verses.korean: 순금으로 거룩한 관의 패를 만들고 도장을 새기듯이 '여호와께 거룩함'이라고 새겼어요.

verses.original: They tied to it a lace of blue, to fasten it on the turban above, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.korean: 파란 끈을 달아 관 위에 묶을 수 있게 했어요. 여호와께서 모세에게 말씀하신 대로였어요.

verses.original: Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting was finished. The children of Israel did according to all that Yahweh commanded Moses; so they did.
verses.korean: 이렇게 회막 성막의 모든 일이 끝났어요. 이스라엘 백성은 여호와께서 모세에게 말씀하신 대로 다 했어요.

verses.original: They brought the tabernacle to Moses: the tent, with all its furniture, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets,
verses.korean: 사람들이 성막을 모세에게 가져왔어요. 천막과 모든 기구들, 갈고리, 널빤지, 가로대, 기둥, 받침을 가져왔어요.

verses.original: the covering of rams' skins dyed red, the covering of sea cow hides, the veil of the screen,
verses.korean: 붉게 물들인 숫양 가죽 덮개, 해달 가죽 덮개, 가리는 휘장도 가져왔어요.

verses.original: the ark of the covenant with its poles, the mercy seat,
verses.korean: 언약궤와 그 채, 속죄소도 가져왔어요.

verses.original: the table, all its vessels, the show bread,
verses.korean: 상과 그 모든 기구와 진설병도 가져왔어요.

verses.original: the pure lamp stand, its lamps, even the lamps to be set in order, all its vessels, the oil for the light,
verses.korean: 순금 등잔대와 그 등잔들, 차례로 놓을 등잔과 모든 기구와 등불용 기름도 가져왔어요.

verses.original: the golden altar, the anointing oil, the sweet incense, the screen for the door of the Tent,
verses.korean: 금 제단, 기름 부음용 기름, 향기로운 향, 천막 문 휘장도 가져왔어요.

verses.original: the bronze altar, its grating of bronze, its poles, all of its vessels, the basin and its base,
verses.korean: 놋 제단과 그 놋 그물과 채와 모든 기구, 물두멍과 그 받침도 가져왔어요.

verses.original: the hangings of the court, its pillars, its sockets, the screen for the gate of the court, its cords, its pins, and all the instruments of the service of the tabernacle, for the Tent of Meeting,
verses.korean: 뜰의 포장과 기둥과 받침, 뜰 문 휘장과 줄과 말뚝, 회막 성막에서 섬기는 데 쓰는 모든 기구를 가져왔어요.

verses.original: the finely worked garments for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.
verses.korean: 거룩한 곳에서 섬길 때 입는 아름다운 옷, 제사장 아론을 위한 거룩한 옷, 그의 아들들이 제사장으로 섬길 때 입는 옷도 가져왔어요.

verses.original: According to all that Yahweh commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did all the work.
verses.korean: 여호와께서 모세에게 말씀하신 대로 이스라엘 백성이 모든 일을 했어요.

verses.original: Moses saw all the work, and behold, they had done it as Yahweh had commanded. They had done so; and Moses blessed them.
verses.korean: 모세가 모든 일을 보니, 여호와께서 명령하신 대로 잘 만들었어요. 그래서 모세가 그들에게 축복해 주었어요.
